name: Ingo Scholtes
content: Prof. Dr. Ingo Scholtes - Machine Learning for Complex Networks Intern Animation stoppen Machine Learning for Complex Networks Prof. Dr. Ingo Scholtes Head of Chair Machine Learning for Complex Networks Emil-Fischer-Strasse 50 D-97074 Würzburg Germany Gebäude: 50 Raum: 03.030 Telefon: +49 931 31-89290 E-Mail: ingo.scholtes@uni-wuerzburg.de I am heading the CAIDAS-Chair of Computer Science - Machine Learning for Complex Networks at the Center for Artificial Intelligence and Data Science of Julius-Maximilians-Universität Würzburg. Our research addresses open questions at the intersection between network science, (deep) graph learning, and computational social science. I have experience in the application of network science and machine learning to address questions in information systems, software engineering, ecology, biology, and physics. A summary of our foundational works on higher-order graph models was published in Nature Physics. In 2014 I was awarded a Juniorfellowship from the German Informatics Society. In 2018 I was awarded an SNSF Professorship with a volume of CHF 1.5 Mio from the Swiss National Science Foundation. I am founding co-chair of the Computational Social Science Section of the German Informatics Society (GI e.V.) and associate editor of EPJ Data Science and Advances in Complex Systems. In my free time, I enjoy mountain hiking, cycling and canoeing. I am also a passionate landscape photographer and astrophotographer. since 08/2021: Chair of Machine Learning for Complex Networks (W3) at Julius-Maximilians-Universität Würzburg 07/2019 - 08/2021: Chair of Data Analytics (W3) at Bergische Universität Wuppertal 08/2018 - 07/2024: SNF Professor for Data Analytics at University of Zurich, Switzerland 04/2016 - 08/2016: Temporary Professor (Vertretungsprofessor) for Applied Informatics at Karlsruher Institut für Technologie (KIT) 09/2011 - 07/2018: Postdoc and Lecturer at Chair of Systems Design, ETH Zürich, Switzerland 07/2011: Visiting Researcher at Eötvös-Lorand University Budapest, Hungary 2011: Dr. rer. nat.
